title: Who will be elected senator from West Virginia in the 2018 midterm elections?
preds: Manchin generally viewed as leading this race... http://wvmetronews.com/2018/10/30/analyst-manchin-likely-to-win-us-senate-contest/ https://www.washingtonpost.com/powerpost/gop-super-pac-scales-back-spending-in-west-virginia-senate-race/2018/11/01/b6c6c0bc-dde2-11e8-85df-7a6b4d25cfbb_story.html?
Manchin leading in polls + national trend and "rust belt" trend all seem to be favorable to D's, so it's hard to imagine a "comeback" scenario for Morrisey.
Affirming for now. Polls are pretty strong for Manchin, but I'm skeptical.
Manchin is in trouble ATM. A double digit lead pre-Kavanaugh dwindled down to tossup, despite his voting to confirm the Judge. Not going well for Dems across the board.

Recent polls may be indicating a closer race, though various 'pundit'  forecasts still (slightly) favor Manchin. Which is probably completely irrelevant with regard to whether West Virginians will vote for a guy whose non-luxury yacht is only worth $220,000. Come on. Shifting a few points toward Manchin as he has led every poll and voted for Kavanaugh. He also has deep roots in the state and as the former governor and I think he has the race locked up.
Manchin on ropes. He broke with Dems and voted for K out of desperation.
Manchin's lead big on paper, but unconvincing. There are too many undecideds to think that the incumbent has it in the bag. I think the undecideds will break for Morrisey.
-4% as he will likely vote vote for Kav confirmation, reactionary Dems will become likely voters.
RCP average has got Manchin up 9.3%. Game over barring a MASSIVE scandal or upset.

Joe Manchin is a good fit for WV and a very good campaigner. He had a genuine quality that is hard to match. Very low negatives. Always a bit of a challenge for a Democrat running in the state that Trump carried by nearly 40 points.

Despite a recent Trump-led rally, not clear if Morrissey is effectively "gaining ground" vs. the established incumbent. Manchin appears likely to vote for Kavanaugh confirmation at this point. https://www.270towin.com/2018-senate-election-predictions/ http://wvmetronews.com/2018/09/14/manchin-morrisey-debate-canceled-after-morrisey-doesnt-commit/ https://www.cnn.com/2018/09/05/politics/kavanaugh-senate-support/index.html http://wvmetronews.com/2018/09/10/west-virginia-poll-voters-say-manchin-should-vote-to-confirm-kavanaugh/
Probably Manchin, but his lead isn't as strong as it looks. Could be a squeaker with Morrisey managing a win.

A change may still be possible, but at present it appears that Manchin remains supportive of the Kavanaugh nomination -- which will probably "play well" (overall) in his home state. https://www.cnn.com/2018/09/05/politics/kavanaugh-senate-support/index.html https://www.dominionpost.com/2018/09/06/poll-trump-scores-higher-for-work-than-likability-in-w-va/

Polls show Manchin ahead and more recent polling hasn't shown him making up that gap as he gets a chance to campaign. Manchin is very popular in WV, despite its strong support for President Trump. Manchin will benefit from his popularity, as well as the momentum behind supporting Democrats in the 2018 midterms. It's hard to imagine Manchin losing unless Democrats dramatically under-perform across the board. One possibility is that Trump visits WV often (he seems to care about the state, about the coal industry, and it's very close to DC), and that his relative popularity in WV (which is far below his 2016 election results there, but still above water) could tilt the election in Morrisey's favor. Will keep monitoring for new polling or news.
Extremizing Manchin's steady lead in the polls (https://www.realclearpolitics.com/epolls/2018/senate/wv/west_virginia_senate_morrisey_vs_manchin-6258.html)

No change to forecast as "campaign season" approaches. Most polls show Manchin currently with a lead. Around half of national 'pundit'  forecasts suggest 'Lean D' at present. Manchin's incumbency, relative familiarity to voters may be advantageous. http://wvmetronews.com/2018/08/31/manchin-has-lead-over-morrisey-metronews-west-virginia-poll-shows/ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Senate_election_in_West_Virginia,_2018 https://www.270towin.com/2018-senate-election-predictions/
Manchin is a strong middle of the road candidate in a deeply red state. Given low-ish turn out he’ll pull enough centrist voters to win

West Virginia is still tilting in favor of the Democratic incumbent, Joe Manchin

Six of the 49 U.S. Senate seats currently held by Democrats are potentially at risk in the midterm elections.* Five of these six seats are in states that Donald Trump won by double digits. The sixth is in the perennial swing state of Florida. The overall results reflect an improvement for Democrats. In early April, eight Democratic seats were at risk. Since then, the races in Ohio and Wisconsin have moved more solidly into the Democratic camp. Overall, the race ratings at ScottRasmussen.com show four races with Democratic senators that are currently considered toss-ups: Florida, Indiana, Missouri, and North Dakota. West Virginia is still tilting in favor of the Democratic incumbent, Joe Manchin. Montana is leaning in the Democrats’ direction but is expected to be competitive. Republicans, in contrast, have only three seats currently at risk: Arizona, Nevada, and Tennessee. With a good turnout this fall, projections at ScottRasmussen.com show that Democrats could win control of the Senate with a narrow 52-48 majority. However, a good Republican turnout could boost the party’s majority to a 56-44 advantage. The Senate playing field is unique. Earlier Numbers of the Day showed that Republicans have far more seats at risk in both the U.S. House elections and the gubernatorial races. In each case, however, the Democrats have improved their position since earlier in the year. *Note: This total includes two independents who caucus with the Democrats: Bernie Sanders and Angus King.
Manchin is up in most polls and Dems have the advantage with Generic polling(+8)

7/18/18: Democrat Manchin has established himself, but WV (generally a historically Democratic-leaning state) went big for Trump in 2016. He seems vulnerable in 2018 but still decided to fight for reelection. http://www.politifact.com/truth-o-meter/statements/2018/jun/26/joe-manchin/did-patrick-morrisey-join-lawsuit-allow-insurers-d/ Reportedly, voters identifying as Democrat still outnumber (declared) Republican voters in WV, but unaffiliated voters have increased.  (Generally at the expense of Democrats.) Manchin has displayed a drop in popularity in one 2018 poll. (Source is linked below:) https://fivethirtyeight.com/features/west-virginias-joe-manchin-is-vulnerable-but-will-the-gop-blow-its-chance/ Trump himself, and possibly further significant developments from the Mueller investigation may be seen as potential "wildcards" for this forecast. How the Kavanaugh nomination unfolds is likely another factor. http://nymag.com/daily/intelligencer/2018/07/manchin-donnelly-will-listen-to-constituents-on-kavanaugh.html https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/news/congress/joe-manchin-vote-on-brett-kavanaugh-supreme-court-hinges-on-obamacare A couple links (further below) to some early poll numbers, almost all of which I've found indicate Manchin having a lead, though no polls are very recent.  Initial forecast somewhat favoring Manchin's chances, for now. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Senate_election_in_West_Virginia,_2018#Polling_3 https://realclearpolitics.com/epolls/2018/senate/wv/west_virginia_senate_morrisey_vs_manchin-6258.html
So far, Manchin's lead is convincing, and there's no reason to think he'll blow it.

Cook has this a toss up [1]. Limited polling has Manchin in the lead +6 points [2] [3]. Prediction market odds have Manchin at 73% [4]. Attorney General Morrisey is a strong challenger. As somebody who sued the Obama administration over environmental regulations he's likely to appeal to Republicans and this is the state where Trump won by the highest margin across all states. Manchin's popularity is not great but not bad either with 43-44  approve-disapprove [3]. Another factor is what I expect will be good turnout for Democrats in rebellion to Trump. [1] https://www.cookpolitical.com/ratings/senate-race-ratings
[2] https://realclearpolitics.com/epolls/2018/senate/wv/west_virginia_senate_morrisey_vs_manchin-6258.html
[3] https://www.vox.com/policy-and-politics/2018/4/30/17285240/senate-elections-2018-midterms-trump-approval-rating-by-state
[4] https://www.predictit.org/Contract/5369/Will-Joe-Manchin-be-re-elected-to-the-US-Senate-in-West-Virginia-in-2018#data
His cautious deference to Trump should be enough to help him hang on.
Manchin has managed to consistently threaded the needle between being a West Virginia Democrat in a Trump state.  He has a good reputation in the state.
